TITLE: As Russia Chokes Ukraine’s Grain Exports, Romania Tries to Fill In
SUMMARY: With famine threatening millions, Europe is intent on finding alternatives to one of world’s biggest food exporters, whose landlocked crop is stranded by war.

TITLE: Fed Confronts a ‘New World’ of Inflation
SUMMARY: Central banks had a longstanding playbook for how inflation worked. In the postpandemic era, all bets are off.

TITLE: Inflation Complicates Biden’s Deliberations on Student Loan Forgiveness
SUMMARY: The president is trying to balance his campaign promise to cancel thousands of dollars in student debt for tens of millions of borrowers with concerns such a move would be seen as a handout.

TITLE: Why the Fed Is Risking a Recession
SUMMARY: Home sales are flagging and the rest of the economy is expected to slow, maybe sharply, as rates increase. Why is the Federal Reserve doing this?

TITLE: Labor Agency Seeks Broad Order Against Starbucks in Federal Court
SUMMARY: The National Labor Relations Board is aiming to stop what it says is extensive illegal activity by the coffee chain amid a national union campaign.

TITLE: Companies Brace for Impact of New Forced Labor Law
SUMMARY: Billions of dollars could be at stake as a law banning imports of some products from China goes into effect.

TITLE: Red Flags for Forced Labor Found in China’s Car Battery Supply Chain
SUMMARY: Ties to potentially coercive labor practices could prove a problem for an industry that is heavily dependent on China, once a new law barring Xinjiang products goes into effect.

TITLE: Starbucks Executive, Prominent in Push Against Union Drive, Will Leave
SUMMARY: Rossann Williams, president of retail for North America, will depart after 17 years at the company, which said she declined a new position with Starbucks.

TITLE: Covid Vaccine and Fisheries Deals Close a ‘Roller Coaster’ W.T.O. Meeting
SUMMARY: Members of the global trade group were forced to scale back plans for more ambitious agreements, but they were ultimately able to reach several deals at a meeting in Geneva.

TITLE: Inflation Expected to Remain High Even as Economy Slows and Layoffs Rise
SUMMARY: Inflation is expected to remain high later this year even as the economy slows and layoffs rise. Already, signs of financial stress are surfacing.

TITLE: What the Fed’s Rate Hike Means for Credit Cards and Student Loans
SUMMARY: Consumers can expect to pay more for some of life’s most common kinds of borrowing.

TITLE: What the Fed’s Rate Hike Means for Mortgages
SUMMARY: Rates on 30-year fixed mortgages track the yield on 10-year Treasury bonds, which are influenced by inflation and the Fed’s actions, among other things.

TITLE: Inside Kraken’s Culture War Stoked by Its C.E.O.
SUMMARY: Jesse Powell, who leads the crypto exchange Kraken, has challenged the use of preferred pronouns, debated who can use racial slurs and called American women “brainwashed.”

TITLE: The Fed Raises Interest Rates by 0.75 Percentage Points to Tackle Inflation
SUMMARY: Central bankers raised interest rates by three-quarters of a percentage point, and signaled that they expect rates to be sharply higher by the end of the year.

TITLE: Biden Weighs Tariff Rollback to Ease Inflation, Even a Little Bit
SUMMARY: While lifting some levies on China is unlikely to put a large dent in inflation, administration officials concede they have few other options to address surging prices.

TITLE: Fed Set to Lift Rates as ‘Soft-ish Landing’ to Slow Inflation
SUMMARY: The central bank has hoped to cool down the economy without pushing unemployment much higher. Stubborn inflation narrows that path.

TITLE: Microsoft Pledges Neutrality in Union Campaigns at Activision
SUMMARY: The accord could ease the path for thousands of workers to unionize at the game company, which Microsoft is acquiring, and addresses an antitrust objection.

TITLE: India’s Economy Is Growing Quickly. Why Can’t It Produce Enough Jobs?
SUMMARY: The disconnect is a result of India’s uneven growth, powered and enjoyed by the country’s upper strata.

TITLE: Inflation in the United States: What You Need to Know
SUMMARY: Inflation is a tricky problem, but it has a few clear causes and consequences, and policymakers are working to bring it to heel.

TITLE: An ‘Ugly’ Inflation Report Upended Hopes That Price Gains Would Ease
SUMMARY: Investors and economists had expected to see some moderation in inflation. Instead, prices accelerated again in May, delivering an unwanted surprise.
